about: Advocate Rajesh K.S has been practicing and handling cases independently with a result oriented approach, both professionally and ethically and has acquired excellent professional experience in providing legal consultancy and advisory services in various fields of law.

Advocate Rajesh provides legal services in a variety of legal areas including, Family Disputes, Property related Matters, Matrimonial Disputes, and Drafting and vetting of various agreements and connected matters, Writ Jurisdiction, Service matters, Civil matters, Criminal matters, and other miscellaneous matters. He has extensive knowledge and expertise in criminal law and has appeared in a variety of criminal matters in various courts in and around Bangalore. He is also very competent in handling divorce and family disputes in original as well as appellate side to achieve excellent results for his clients.

Advocate Rajesh is enrolled with the Bar Council of Karnataka. He has a significant amount of professional experience in providing all kinds of legal consultancy and advisory services. Advocate Rajesh's professional experience has led him to gain proficiency, not only in arguing before the Honorable Courts, but also in consulting clients and even in the art of drafting and pleading.

questions_answered: How to deal with harassing husband ?

I have been married for 7 years now. Since, the marriage it was trouble. my husband is harassing me mentally. in the early phases of marriage, He used to tell me that he married me because of his mother who forced him to do so and he scolds his mother. He also said to return the thali and go back home. He also left me in the railway statement in the mid night after a fight all alone. I was pleading him not to leave me, but he left. He gets angry uncontrollably. He blames me for everything. If there is traffic jam, he blames. If kid is little cranky, he blames me. If kid supports me, he starts abusing kid also. He shows face everytime when he comes home and keeps blaming me everytime and scolds me. He threatens me saying that he will snatch the kid from me and he will leave. In case if my parents come to stop him, he will kill them. All this is increasing my tension day by day. I am staying with him only because of kid. I want to get out of this marriage. But, I want my kid also .Please help

You can file divorce case and you can also file dowry harassment case if you want because there is a chance of arresting your husband. You can file domestic violence case and you can also claim maintenance. Don't minor kid custody first preference will be given to mother by the court. Contact us to proceed further.
Limitation to challenge registered partition deed ?

Our Family executed a Partition deed between 4 brothers in 1999.Of the 4 parts, 2 brothers were given 1 share each and the 2 shares were clubbed together and allocated to the remaining 2 brothers because one of the person was disabled and the other brother was looking after this disabled bachelor brother. Now the remaining 2 brothers are claiming 1/3 of share from the disabled brother's share since he did not execute any will to the brother who looked after him. The case has been filed after 12 years the partition was executed. can registered partition deed be challenged ?

As you have mentioned it is family property your disabled brother will also get his right in the property with siblings and hence no one can grab it without his consent and he has to decide to dispose his right through his wish. As there is a misunderstanding about the partition that can be challenged whomever who is aggrieved among you by making your disabled brother as a party at civil court. Usually civil suits have 30 years time limitation. As there is a illegality you can challenge the partition deed  as it came to your knowledge now or depending upon the recent developments by explaining the same to court. Consult any advocate.
I have a query regarding Sale deed and car parking, can builder sell parking, What are my option ?

I booked a ready to move in flat. The builder included 3 lacs for car parking in cost sheet. I agreed to that. He sent me a draft copy of sale deed on which he mentioned the car parking number along with house details. After I gave him the first 20 percent check for first installment he provided me the modified sale deed on which the car parking not mentioned in sale deed. He also got 0.1 percent for franking charges. Kindly advice me whether the car parking details should be mentioned in sale deed or not? Still I have not signed the sale deed.Kindly let me know whether the builder can complete the franking formalities without my signature in sale deed. Thank you.

Discuss with him about the change of agreed clause if he doesn't accept or replies in vague manner then cancel the purchase as you have not signed on the sale deed there is nothing to worry because you have to be present at Sub Registrar office while entering into an sale deed with your signature. As I mentioned if you don't get proper solution the issue a legal notice by cancelling the sale transaction with him, If you have entered into an sale agreement then go through the clause and conditions of the same and find out whether the act of builder comes under violation of the agreement even otherwise he has to comply as he has taken Rs.3 Lakh by mentioning in the cost sheet. Without your signature franking done on any document is not valid. Hence Contact advocate after cautioning the builder about his unlawful act.
What is the procedure to revoke a gift deed of property once it is made? Can a gift deed be revoked?

My wife has gifted a property to her sister through a gift deed just 10 days ago. Now, she wants to take back that property. On what grounds can she fight the case, and please tell us, can a gift deed be revoked? Specifically, can a gift deed be revoked, and how can a gift deed be revoked?

If the Gift deed is registered then your wife has to file a civil suit before the jurisdictional city civil court for revocation of gift. It cannot be done through Sub Registrar Court. So contact any advocate if it is an registered deed to revoke the same before court
Ex girlfriend threatening to kill herself and blackmailing me

I was in a relationship with a girl and we brokeup. Now I am getting married but the girl is threatening me of defamation and that she will commit suicide. She doesn't want to marry me but only creating an issue. She has mental issues and I have sufficient proofs of it. The only problem is she has pictures of a fight with me (only she is visible) where she was both of us were injured. But only her injuries are there in the pictures. She is blackmailing for more than a year. I have call records which prove that she is threatening falsely. She has already started defaming me on social media by messaging relatives. what to do if someone is blackmailing you? Should I apply for anticipatory bail? What will be the consequences if I do so?

You file a complaint against her for threatening and defaming in social networks on her first. If you think she is going to file any case the procure all the said documents as evidence then you can take anticipatory bail and fight the case to prove your innocence.

practice_areas: Anti Corruption, Anticipatory Bail, Arbitration, Banking / Finance, Bankruptcy / Insolvency, Breach of Contract, Cheque Bounce, Child Custody, Consumer Court, Corporate, Court Marriage, Criminal, Cyber Crime, Divorce, Domestic Violence, Dowry Case, Family, Fraud Case, High Court, Immigration, International Law, Labour & Service, Media and Entertainment, Medical Negligence, NCLT, NRI, Pmla, Pocso Act, Property, Recovery, RERA, Succession Certificate, Supreme Court, Wills / Trusts
about: Advocate Ricky Chopra is an experienced disputes resolution expert. His offices represent clients either in defence or in prosecution of criminal & civil charges including divorce matters. Advocate Chopra has been awarded as the White Collar Crimes lawyer in India by Corporate INTL. His practice also includes representing clients before the Supreme Court, High Courts and the Consumer forums.

Advocate Ricky Chopra is a 2001 graduate of Delhi University’s Campus Law Centre, having practiced between 2001 and 2009 in his own firm, the Law Offices of Ricky Chopra, before joining one of the top law firms in the capacity of Partner in their Delhi office. After working with the law firm for 5 years, Advocate Chopra started his own law firm in Gurgaon in November 2016.

Advocate Ricky Chopra also lived in New York for many years and had his own practice there, helping a lot of Indian clients with their needs in New York. He has an expertise in handling international law and immigration related legal issues.
Advocate Ricky Chopra enrolled with the Bar Council of Delhi in 2001. He is a member of the Delhi High Court Bar Association.

name: Advocate Wg Cdr Ajit Kakkar (Retd)
practice_areas: Armed Forces Tribunal, Domestic Violence, Dowry Case, High Court, Labour & Service, NRI, R.T.I
about: Advocate Ajit Kakkar is a Military Law & Service Law Consultant, Specialist in Service Matters, Military Law, Courts-Martial, Military Service litigation and matrimonial Issues. As a Military Advocate dealing with Army Law, Navy Law and Air Force Law, he had taken Premature Retirement from Air Force in 2012 and his last appointment was Joint Judge Advocate General (Air).

Advocate Kakkar deals in Army, Air Force, and Navy court cases Legal Advisor in BSF, CRPF, and CISF matters. He takes up litigation matters related to Service Pension, Disability pension, Promotion, Discharge, Extension of Service etc. As a Military Lawyer at the Armed Forces Tribunal, he is dealing with Army Law, Navy Law, and Air Force Law. As a service matter expert, he deals with all issues related to The Central Civil Service (Classification, Control and Appeal) Rules 1965, CCS-CCA-Rules-1965. He has been handling matrimonial issues while in service and continued taking up matters in civil courts as well on all kinds of matrimonial issues

Advocate Kakkar has also specialized in International Trade laws, he had obtained one-year Diploma from ILI New Delhi and effectively dealing with arbitration matters and other issues relating to trade laws.

Advocate Kakkar has 18 years of Experience of practice, 12 years as a Judge Advocate in the Air Force and 6 years as an advocate in Civil Courts. He has conducted various Courts-Martial as a Judge, advocate as well as a Defense Counsel. He takes up all kinds of Military matters of Promotion, Releases, Discharges, Postings, Dismissals, Pension, Maintenance Allowances, Recoveries, Awards, Administrative Action etc.
Advocate Kakkar is practicing as an Advocate at Supreme Court, High Court of Delhi, Central Administrative Tribunal & the Armed Forces Tribunals.

He is a National level sports person and participated in International Sports events, He was Director in Common Wealth Games, New Delhi (2010), Military World Games (2007) South Asian Federation Games Dhaka and Partile Cup Sweden. He has also done MBA in Sports Management and doing research in Sports Law.
He had enrolled with the Bar Council of Delhi in 2012. He is a member of the AFT Bar Association and the Delhi High Court Bar association.
Enrolment Number: D/3842/2012.

questions_answered: Can I resign from Indian air force?

Sir, I am currently serving in the Indian Air Force, having completed 4 years of service. I wish to resign due to personal reasons. However, as per Air Force regulations, there is a minimum service requirement of 20 years, can I resign from Indian air force?

Hi, your case is peculiar and out of the policy of Air Force, you may like to take consultation from us, personal meeting or telephonic. Your query can not be replied in public . you have to make out some grounds as per AFO Regds
Do you have to declare marital status  in government application ?

Dear Sir, I am 24 yrs girl. i want to marry a boy but my parents are against of this. So we decided to marry in arya samaj mandir. But we want that our marriage remain confidential. As i am preparing for goverment exams so i have to fill many forms so if we do marriage is it necessary to mention there that I am married or i can fill it single?? Is hiding marital status in govt job crime? plz solve my query asap

Hi   You are well within your rights to keep your marriage as confidential but if specific question is asked you need to reply correctly. After filling up form you are supposed to verify the form that all information given above are correct to the best of your knowledge. If you submit wrong information your form is liable to be rejected. If this information found out to be false after your appointment, your appointment is liable to be set aside. You may decide as to which action is beneficial to you, for further clarification you may call us. Regards
Action for loss of identity card & cant appear for commission exam

Sir I am a serving jco in army. Sir I lost my I card while playing a volleyball match .and got red ink entry .. sir can my red ink be written off or can it be turned down to black.. as it is stopping me to appear for commission exams..if yes how .? Plz help..

Hi Since you lost I card while playing a volleyball match inside the campus area, you are considered on duty you can write to you CO to consider you for lesser punishment which is permitted and your case will be considered by the competent authority.Make an application without delay. All the best
Clarification regarding disability pension of personnel of AFO

sir.....they r asking for remustering and i am giving unwillingness....and as per AFO i an airwarrior is giving unwillingness for remustering then he will be discharged..... I am A4G4(P)....15-19 % disability.... Am i eligible for pension... disability pension..... ex-servicemen quota

Hi Your case is the peculiar and borderline case, having medical Category A4G4 and disability only 15-19% is not proper but under present circumstances, we need to know more about kind of disability you are having. sometimes at the time of discharge during your release medical board if your disability is further reduced you will be further placed in a disadvantaged position. At this stage, you are at risk on this issue kindly take proper advise by sharing all the facts.All the best
Can I broadband my disability pension from 50% to 75%?
I am in receipt of 50%Disability pension. I would like to know whether I am eligible for Broadbanding to75%

HiAll armed forces personnel drawing their disability pension are authorized to rounding off of their disability pension. Broad banding is when a person is drawing 1 to 49 % disability pension is authorized to draw 50%, a person drawing 50% to 75% is authorized to rounding off to 75% and a person drawing 76% and more is authorized to rounding off his disability to 100%. You are entitled to get your disability to be rounded of to 75% as you are drawing 50%. You need to write to your record office. Incase you find any difficulty or your record office refused to round off you may contact us. All the best

questions_answered: Supply Payment recovery from a p ltd firm and he has availed gst input
Can i ibc case be filed in nclt if total amount with interest only crosses 1cr and not the principal amount ? And if not in ibc What is the best way to recover money at the earliest

Best way to recover the money is through MSME Samadhaan, specially in the business transactions when the GST invoice is there and other documents like purchase order, Eway bill etc for the support of the same
Section 138 of negotiable instrument act 1881 as ammended sec 420

She was my gf she needed money but I already hv taken loan from banks so I had no money. One day I was doing some paperwork for loan n my bank papers were on the bed she came home when she went I noticed that my one cheque is disappeared becoz I don't do transaction from check ofen so I knew I asked her she denied so I called bank n said if anyone comes just stop the check now she sent me notice that I took loan rs 45000 from her one month ago n I gave her check n just like that act 138 she has only one proof cheque I hv no proof except truth how to prove it . I hv hired a lawyer but I m very worried plz help me.

In reply to the legal notice you should state these facts. That since there was no legal debt and liablity so you can escape from conviction by easy way. For prosecution comlainant has to show the liablity legally discharged by u.
How to get refund amount after closure of account books of the flat?

I bought a flat in resale in IRWO project Panchkula and got it duly transferred in year 2010 and even the convince deed has been done on my name in the year 2012. At the time of transfer as per IRWO transfer policies all necessary undertakings were submitted by transferor and transferee including the affidavit signed by the transferor regarding any refund which may be there after closing of account books related to this property shall be paid to the transferee. But now IRWO has send a cheque of refund amounting Rs. 30000 at my address, but cheque is on the name of first allottee/ transferor. When I insisted them to issue the refund cheque on my name, they say it's according to rules, to be returned to the transferor. Who had actually paid the full amount to IRWO initially. So, plz clarify whether, who legally should get the refund cheque now. I have CTC copies of all such undertakings and affidavits deposited at the time of transfer at IRWO office.

That you are entitled to get the refund in case the necessary documents have been executed by the allottee in your favour. That RWA officials might be asking the no objection certificate issued in your favour by the allottee. In case of non payment you can approach the Court of Public Utility services.
Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act
Please send me a complete deatils of section 9 . I want to file a petiton of section 9 against my wife ..whats the benifiet for section 9

Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act relates to restitution of conjugal rights. That in case your wife is residing separately without any sufficient cause you can file petition under Section 9 of the H.M. Act for restitution of conjugal rights.
Reduce monthly maintenance amount after mutual consent divorce

My divorce happened in May 2015, started with contested and ended up with mutual consent. My ex-wife had put all kinds of DV and Dowry cases on me and my parents in 2014, even though we were living separated since 2009. Anyways, the divorce happened in May 2015 and the monthly maintenance was settled for 55k, with an increase of 5k every alternate year, so its 60k now. Unfortunately, I do not have means to support this money, and am already in debt and am not able to pay my EMIs also to bank which I had taken for business loan (to start new work last year) and personal loan (to give her monthly maintenance). Unfortunately the new work hasnt kicked off and Im in grave financial debt. I married again in Dec 2016 and she has been supporting me financially and running the house, but kindly suggest, how can I reduce my monthly maintenance of 60k to atleast half, as the situation is very bad and its not correct to put this financial strain on my wife.

That in case facts changed the maintenance amount can be altered. for doing so you have to approach the Court with changed circumstances but with proof what you are alleging. The court will consider the same and you will get the relief.

questions_answered: Procedure to follow in cheque bounce matter

2 party ne mujhe ek ek cheque diye maal kharidne ke baste maine unko maal de diya jab maine vo cheque apne a/c me lagya to ek me stop balance aur ek me no balance se bapas a gye aur payment nahi hua.is par maine dono ko notice diya sec. 138 ke anusar 15 din se pahele ek party ka jabab a gya aur ek party ka jabab nahi aya. jiska jabab aya vo apna cheque khona bata raha h. ab mujhe kya karna hoga in dono ke khilap criminal case hoga ya civil case ya dono karne hoge. case kaise file karna h police ke ya court ke hisab se. ek cheque 150,000 aur dusra 50,000 rupees ka h court fees kitni lagegi.

इस मामले में धारा 138 NI Act के अंतर्गत कम्पलेन्ट केस  नोटिस देने के 15 दिन बाद से 30 दिन के अंदर दाखिल करना होगा केस अधिवक्ता के द्वारा दाखिल करवाना होगा। आपके पास माल भेजने का बिल बुक ही पर्याप्त सबूत है
Validity of general power of attorney  in court

Dear Sir / Mam I want to ask a question related to General Power of attorney. I have a house fully in my possession with electricity meter and house tax with my name. But it is on GPA. Is it valid in the court or will it be count my property if someone challenge in the legal way? and what is validity of power of attorney for property?

Power of attorney is a authorization (adhikar patra) it's not a sale deed. Through POA you can take care and manage the related property and you can also do the related work through it but you can't b the owner through POA. property title only belongs to sale deed, will and gift transfer. So you are not the owner of this property.

Advocate Suksham provides services in various fields of international law related matters,consumer court matters, criminal matters, family matters and drafting and vetting of various agreements and documents.

questions_answered: Mobile phone recording as evidence whether legal in India ?

Got married in dec. 2014 and wife left home dec. 2015 and now she has filed DV act ,498A crpc 125 case against me, mother & Elder Brother. After marriage she inserted memory card in mother phone and changed settings to Automatic call recording ON & started daily fighting with us with abuse language to provoke us for domestic violence but we did not do anything with her & mother shared all these things with elder brother on phone & she took those recordings and now she is planning to use those recordings in court as evidence. She did recordings upto 7-8 months without permission. Recordings like this is legal in India & can call recording be used as evidence in india? Laws to show recordings like this is illegal in India? Laws by which we can treat recordings illegal these recordings? What counter cases we can file for these illegal recordings? Kindly give legal opinion/advice. what is the supreme court judgement on call recording ? ,Highly thankful for your support.

HiYou should take an immediate action against your wife alleging that she has defamed you and hindered your privacy by keeping a record of your call after you both were separated. Also your mother and brother can file cases for harassment and mental agony against your wife. The call recordings can be taken as evidence 8n the court if they prove something substantial related to the case
How to get 2 year old call history ?
HOW OLD CALL DETAILS CAN BE TRACED ?, CAN WE GET 2 YEARS OLD PH CALLS DETAILS OF OTHER PERSON.WHAT WILL BE PROCEDURE.

Dear ClientThe telecom companies by the mandate imposed by TRAI cannot keep the phone call details of any person for a period preceding 3 months of now. And legally to get the phone details of other person you will have to get specific order from the court
can i get divorce without going to court in india ?
Can I give divorce without appear court proceedings ,how to apply divorce online ?

Dear ClientYou can get contested divorce without appearing in the court. However in case you wish to apply for divorce by mutual consent then there is no way of getting divorce without appearing before the courts. You can call for further details
Forced Strip Search in school due to suspicions of carrying an E-Cig

Hello! I was recently strip searched against my will in my school due to suspicions of carrying an e-cig, i was wondering if what happened was legal? my co-ordinator asked a PE teacher to check my underwear for it and i denied but she insisted and as i had a fear of my parents knowing i had to go through with it, it has been a few days and i feel horrible because the PE teacher touched me in an area i was not comfortable with. I was carrying an e-cig because I am currently trying to beat my cigarette addiction. I do not wish for the PE teacher to get into trouble as he understood my situation and didn't want to do it either but he had to because of the teacher. Please let me know the legal opinion on this, thanks!

HiWhat has been done by your school staff is completely illegal and you are completely eligible to take an action against your offending teacher or school staff. you can contact me telephonically for advise on this matter
I had been married in 2017 in mandir but doesn't have any proof of date of marriage  I don't have an

I had been married in 2017 in mandir but doesn't have any proof of date of marriage  I don't have any invitation card or priest slip I want to apply for marriage certificate registration how can I get that help me urgently required looking for favorable response

hiyou need not necessarily have marriage invitation card for getting your marriage registered. however since the marriage is 5 years old and mandatory period of registration of marriage is 90 days, therefore it can only be done with the permission of DC. you can contact me for detailed advise and action in this regard.
faq: Can Advocate Suksham Aggarwal represent me in court?
Yes, Advocate Suksham Aggarwal can represent you in court. The lawyer is trained to present your case in the most effective way possible.
What should I bring to my initial consultation with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal?

When you meet with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal for an initial consultation, it is important to bring any relevant documents or information with you. This may include documents related to your legal issue, such as contracts or court orders, as well as any other relevant information, such as a list of questions or concerns you have about your case.
How do I prepare for my initial consultation with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal?

Before your initial consultation with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal, it can be helpful to think about the specific legal issue you are facing and any questions or concerns you have about your case. You should also gather any relevant documents or information that you think may be helpful in understanding your situation.
What should I expect during my initial consultation with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal?

During your initial consultation with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal, you can expect to discuss the specific legal issue you are facing and the details of your situation. Lawyer will ask you questions to get a better understanding of your case and will provide you with information about your legal options and any potential outcomes.
How do I communicate with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal?

It is important to communicate with Advocate Suksham Aggarwal regularly to stay updated on the progress of your case and to discuss any new developments or concerns you may have. You can communicate with the lawyer through phone calls, emails, or in-person meetings.
How much does it cost to hire Advocate Suksham Aggarwal?

The cost of hiring Advocate Suksham Aggarwal can vary widely. Some lawyers charge hourly rates, while others charge a flat fee for their services. Some also offer free initial consultations to discuss your case. Kindly contact the lawyer directly to enquire about the fee.

name: Advocate Bala Janaki
practice_areas: Anti Corruption, Anticipatory Bail, Arbitration, Banking / Finance, Cheque Bounce, Child Custody, Consumer Court, Corporate, Customs & Central Excise, Divorce, Dowry Case, Family, Fraud Case, Immigration, International Law, Pmla, Pocso Act, Property, Startup, Supreme Court, Trademark & Copyright, Wills / Trusts, Women
about: Advocate Balajanaki Srinivasan (Bala) holds dual qualifications as Solicitor (England & Wales) and a Lawyer in India with extensive exposure to most areas of law.

Advocate Bala Janaki completed her law in the year 1985 and has been providing services in various fields of law, that is, Arbitration, Trademark & Copyright, Family, Property, Criminal, Civil, Consumer Court, Recovery and drafting and vetting of various agreements and documents.

She is a specialist in Intellectual Property Law covering, Brand protection (from registrations of Trademarks, Patent, Copyright, and Design Act to enforcement of IP rights), IP Investigation, IP Valuation, and Litigation.

Advocate Bala has built a reputation as a formidable lawyer in native India where she established Rights &Marks law firm in 2002, one of the fastest growing law practices in India. Rights & Marks launched its first base in the Middle East with the opening of its new office in the UAE in 2014.
Advocate Bala Janaki enrolled with the Bar Council of Tamil Nadu & Puducherry in 1985. She is a member of the Madras High Court Bar Association.

questions_answered: What to do if someone is calling me again and again ?

A person name is troubling me by giving multiple of messages and calls. I had even warned him and not to call and give messeges. But still he calls me and texts I love you etc. It is almost 4 months now. I even scolded him and said not to give any messeges else I will report him to cyber crime. But he says I'm not doing anything wrong. I m just texting I love you. And I want to marry you. But you are doing wrong. You are scolding me. And I can also report you as you are scolding. But I will not bcoz I love you. Always he texts I love you. Whenever I warns him he says please don't decline and please don't avoid me, I love you. Sometimes he send messeges at even in mid night 4am. Sometimes he calls at 5am and disturbs me. Always I see he writes I love you, good morning etc. My mother and my cousin also warned him not to text anything. But still he text me. I am irritated. He is from puri orissa. Sir/ mam plz suggest me what to do if someone is calling again and again ? what can the police do about harassing texts ?

kindly prepare a complaint application and file it before the police station of your jurisdiction they will initiate action against the culprit . Other option in case the local police station is not taking any action get in touch of a lawyer to guide u accordingly.
Annulment vs divorce which will be good for me i dont want a divorcee

Team i got married on 17th march 2020 pune court marraige , it was a love marriage. as marriage happened my wife went to her hometown as lockdown was gng to start till now she is in her hometown. after marriage we have never stated together as it was court marriage ,her parents said in nov once Hindu marriage happens then you stay. so no physical contact after court marriage now we were in relation for 5 months before we got married. reason i did court marriage so early i am about to o to europe so i wanted to take her with me now as sson as she got home our small fights beacem big recently she told everything at her home pl note here we had verbal spats on trust issues as she had cheated me before marriage but i forgive her  and married her now she has blocked me n family from everywhere her dad calls my home says akshay ka gussa hai and all i have not said about her anything bad at my home she has spitted venom against me in her family i was not aware about all this before i married

No annulment or divorce can be filed unless one year is elapsed from the date of marriage .If u wish to then we have to seek special permission for filing from the court . annulment has certain grounds which cannot be applied in your case so it is better for a mutual divorce.
Rights of daughter of divorced women

If divorced is done by mutual concent using only 13b  in that if it is that father is liable to pay some amount to daughter till daughters age 18. in such cases if during this period if father refuses to give the said monthly money to daughter Then can we file any legal complaint against the father.

daughter can seek the remedy as per sec. 125 of crpc for maintenance if the mother is unable to maintain her being a minor. plus the mother too can seek maintenance if unable to maintain herself even after the divorce.
Wife Threatning to file false 498a on me and family.

Hi Advocate, My wife is picking fights on every next day with me or my family without any reason. As she is 3 months pregnant we are trying to let it go and trying to behave well with her. She abuses me and family and threaten us of filing false cases against us. We haven't taken any dowry during marriage and also we have done 90% of marriage expense as they were not well to do and as this was second marriage for her(she had one failed marriage earlier). Pleae help us out as we are in deep trouble. Thank you.

viable   send her to maternal home  so that  the issues  not escalated  later   we can initiate  legal proceeding  against  your wife  if you need  proper   legal consultation   you may  contact me   through this portal for further guidance
Want to submit an evidence in the final stage of argument

Hi, The case is in Final Arguements stage I now traced out a vital evidence which I did not submit at Affidavit of Evidence stage or additional Evidence stage If I submit now in arguements stage will the Judge in District consumer Forum accept it ??

Can a married woman live with another man without divorce ?
Can a married woman leave her husband to stay with her lover before filing for divorce? Is this legally possible under Hindu law? Is extra-marital affair legal in India?

Dear Concerned,

No, a married woman or married man cannot stay with another man or woman without legally ending their first marriage. Doing so is considered adultery, which was previously a punishable offense under Section 497 of the Indian Penal Code (now decriminalized but still a valid ground for divorce).

How much time does it take to get bail in IPC 326 case, and How to get bail in IPC 326 case

My friend's arrest under false IPC 326 involves two others. He's accused of using hands, while they allegedly used a stick. It's been 18 days; I seek guidance on the bail process and expected duration. How much time does it take to get bail in IPC 326 case?

Dear Client, bail is not granted automatically. Your advocate needs to apply for the same, and the court, after reviewing the bail application, FIR, and statements, will decide on granting bail. Section 326 IPC punishment deals with causing grievous hurt by a dangerous weapon. Based on the allegations made against your friend, the court will consider bail. He can file a bail application before the Sessions Court or High Court if the magistrate denies bail. It would be advisable to consult an impaneled advocate. While going for the consultation, carry all your supportive documents to receive precise legal advice. Regards, EXPERT JURIST LLP.

Process to transfer Mhada flat to spouse name

My husband owned a MHADA flat in Mumbai. Unfortunately, he passed away last year during COVID. I am his legal heir, along with our three children, who live in different cities. I would like to transfer the MHADA flat ownership to my name. Could you please provide details on the MHADA name transfer procedure in case of death? What steps should I follow for a smooth transfer process?

MHADA has a structured transfer process, and transferring ownership after the death of the original owner requires proper documentation and approvals. The procedure has been made simpler with online services, but it still involves multiple steps, legal formalities, and compliance with MHADA rules and regulations for transfer of flat.

If you need assistance with the MHADA ownership transfer procedure, documentation, or legal formalities, feel free to contact us for expert guidance and a hassle-free process.

questions_answered: Can I take back the surety I provided for a relative's bail? How to withdraw bail surety, and what i

I have submitted my property documents as surety for my relative's bail under the NDPS Act. However, I believe he may not comply with legal proceedings, which could lead to problems for me in the future. How can I withdraw bail surety, and can I file an application for withdrawal of surety to request the court to cancel his bail?

You can take back surety  at any time . You can file an application in court relating to withdrawal of surety bonds fgiven in favour of accused. Court will not raise any objection or any party to the case objections will not be entrtained.
what is bisra report? What is the full form of Bisra report?
Sir, what is a Bisra report, and what relevance does it have in a case of IPC 304 and 34? Can you please explain the full form of the Bisra report?

In case of poisoning or any other susbtance given to a person case , the doctors while sending their report in court send the visra report. Visra report is the report beased on chemical examiner examination of liver, stomach and kedenys during postmortem. The liver, stomach and kedneys are send in JAR to chemical examiner to have visra report
Where to complain if someone is blackmailing you ?

Hi, I had a boyfriend who has been blackmailing me for the past few months. I changed my number, but he is still sending me messages on Snapchat. He has been threatening me and we have some pictures together. What to do if someone is blackmailing you? How can I file a blackmail complaint? Please help me.

If someone is blackmailing you, report their actions immediately to your nearest police station or the cybercrime cell. If the police do not act, you can file a complaint before a magistrate. You can also report blackmailing and the misuse of your pictures to the authorities. If you need legal assistance, consult a good lawyer to take action against the blackmailer.
what to do if husband is not ready to give divorce in india

I am a wife and married for 5 years with one child. I am living separately for almost 2 years. I don't want to live with my husband . I have gone through a lot of physical and mental trauma caused by not only my husband but my entire in laws family. I want divorce but my husband and his family are not ready for mutual consent as they are axpecting dowry and want me to suffer my whole life like this. My husband told me that he will not give me divorce just because he want my family to cover expenses of settling abroad. What can I do what if husband is not giving divorce? Is there any fast track option available to get divorce?

MamYou can file a divorce petition under section 13 Hindu marriage act on th grounds of desertion and mental cruelty by your husband in family courts and can have divorce . This is the best ground on which u can seek divorce easily .
My husband and in laws are torturing me how to take legal action now

My husband lied to me before marriage about his salary and job. He wants my parents to purchase things for home, when I refused , he sent me back to my home with love and now he doesn't want me to come back. I compromised , adjusted but now I m so broken and dont know where to go! My father took a loan for this marriage and gave everything my in laws wanted Please advice

Mam u can file a divorce case on the grounds of concealments of fact and u can also file dowry and crulety case under section 406 498 IpC and can also claim maintence from your husband under section 125 crpc.

questions_answered: In-laws not allowing to meet and stay with my parents vacation

Please let me know the rules and laws for the married women. Can she go for vacation to meet her parents as they are staying away from munbai? As everytime I want to go, they refuse to allow me and we all fight together for the same issue. My husband and mon-in-law says, now u have to think only for ur husband and his family. Please let me know the rights the  married women should have after marriage.

getting married does not mean that you surrender all your freedom . it is  your right to go and meet your parents  and your husband cannot prevent you from  that . this may also amount to domestic violence  as they are not allowing you to go to your parents place .
Regarding registration of marriage twice with same person
Can i register my marriage twice with same person ? 1st in court and  2nd in local municipal corporation.

Marriage is registered before the Marriage Registrar and not before the Court. Further such power of Marriage Registrar is given to the Municipal Corporation, who can register the marriage. Different states have different rules with respect to marriage registration,  therefore I need to know which state you belong,  to  so that  I can guide you further.
False 498a/DV/Maintenance Case By Fraud Wife & In-Laws

BACKGROUND : Met the girl though matrimonial site. My brother married her in her own state where she lives. After 30 days, she fled with all the jewelry (her own and the ones we gave her). Filed a false 498a/DV/Maintenance case in her state.All allegations in her complaint are the general trash (physical/mental torture, physical/verbal/mental abuse, etc.) & vague, no date, day etc.CASE STATUS :- Maintenance : Rejoinder-DV : Appearance-498a : InvestigationQUESTIONSQ1) Can we get exemption from physical attendance due to long distance, including my brother? Their city is 1200kms away from our city.Q2) We have CCTV footage of her fleeing the house with all her luggage (1 suitcase, 1 bag, 1 handbag, she is also wearing all her jewelry) when we were not present. Also, full day footage of her when she lived with us. We have CCTV everywhere except the bedroom and toilet. Can we use this & free ourselves from this wretched woman & can we quash on the false cases based on CCTV footage ?

You can file a police complaint that she has stolen and fled with all jewellery and valuables.  you have not mentioned whether or not the FIR has been registered u/s 498A, and whether the same was submitted for counselling before Family welfare cell or some thing of the sort. In case if the FIR is registered need to take ABA and also based on the facts go for quashing the FIR. You need not attend all the dates of hearing and your Advocate may seek exemption on some dates.You will have to file for divorce to get rid of her.
Domestic violenece,bigamy dowry demand,second marriage

1.If person performs second marriage with all ceremonies, without taking lawful divorce from first wife and hiding the fact of his first marriage can be punishable under bigamy?2.What about second wife and all other relatives who attends the marriage?3.Whether they are also punishable same as the husband?

They can also be indicted if they were aware of the true facts and in spite of that and in furtherance of the said offence they took part in the same. The said offence of Bigamy is punishable upto 7 years of imprisonment u/s 494 of IPC.
I am a Hindu with wife three daughters and a son.
My daughters are married and well provided.I want to bequeath my properties to my wife and on her death to my son.Is it possible
Dear ClientYes life interest in your self acquired properties can be given to your wife.   and on her death the same can be bequeathed to your son. Are the properties your self acquired or ancestral.

name: Advocate Chitra Bhanu Gupta
practice_areas: Anti Corruption, Cheque Bounce, Child Custody, Consumer Court, Corporate, Criminal, Divorce, Dowry Case, Family, Fraud Case, High Court, Immigration, Labour & Service, NRI, Pmla, Pocso Act, Property, Recovery, Wills / Trusts
about: Advocate Chitra Bhanu Gupta has been enrolled in the year 2004 and is having more than 15 years of experience in both Corporate and Government Organisation.

Presently practicing as an Advocate / Private Attorney / Consultant, Litigation Expert at the Hon’ble High Court, Calcutta and various District Courts, Tribunals such as Land Administrative Tribunals, Central and State Administrative Tribunals and Forums including the Consumer Forums. Dealing with matters relating to Civil, Criminal, Corporate, Arbitration Land and Real Estate and Finance Recovery Matters.

His present Clientele Includes Multinational Giants such as Landmark Cars (Mercedes Benz India Ltd) and SAN Infrastructure Ltd. He is looking after the cases pertaining to the entire Kolkata and surrounding region with regards to Landmark Cars (Mercedes Benz India Ltd) and has been assisting the corporation with his legal ideas and decisions.

Apart from this he is also attached as Empanelled Lawyer at Several Banks and Financial Institutions such as Canara Bank, HDFC Bank Ltd and Uttarbanga Kshetriya Gramin Bank dealing with recovery matters and target oriented litigations.

Mr. Gupta is also associated with several diversified project sectors such as Sova Solar Limited dealing in the Power Generation Sector and is a constant empanelled lawyer of the West Bengal State Electricity Development Corporation Ltd. To name a few.
He is presently the legal advisor of Duranto Footwear Industries Ltd and deals mostly in the recovery issues of the company.

Advocate Gupta has also Represented the Company Pt. Bina Insan Sukses Mandiri in International Dispute at Jakarta, Indonesia with regards to Multi Million Dollars Coal Dispute in connection with the company by appearing at the Jakarta Law Firms at Indonesia.

He has even Acted as the Legal Advisor of SPML Infrastructure Limited dealing mainly with Arbitration Matters, and Infrastructure related Legal Issues of the Company. Dealt with many big Ticket State Level Projects including the Arbitration Proceeding relating to a Sensitive project of 31 Crore Bank Guarantee Invocation by National Thermal Power Corporation and other arbitration proceeding relating to recovery of amounts from West Bengal Power Development Corporation Limited and also  relating to Recovery of 20 Crore money from Arunachal Pradesh Department of Power in relation with Major Hydro Electricity Power Plants.

In his early years he has been associated with the Government Legal Sector at West Bengal Industrial Development Corporation thereby handling several sensitive Government Projects dealing with many big-Ticket State Level Projects. He has recently successfully settled a case pertaining to a motor giant Maruti Suzuki India Ltd. Before the National Consumer Commission at New Delhi.

Advocate Gupta has obtained his graduate degree from the University of Calcutta. Besides this, he also holds a Post Graduate Degree in International Business Laws and a Certificate in Computer Application.
Mr. Gupta holds wide experience and expertise in dealing with matters including
•	Land and Real Estate Litigations including the litigations before the West Bengal Land Reforms and Tenancy Tribunals.

•	Property Related Legal Assistance Including the conducting of searches before the Various Registry Offices, BL & LRO and to the District Level, providing reports and conducting Registrations of properties.
•	Matrimonial Disputes and Divorce related Cases
•	Cheque Dishonor Recovery through Litigation.
•	Insurance Related Matters and recovery of Insurance related Claim cases such as Mediclaim, or Personal Accident Claim cases and other matters relating to the settlement of Insurance claims.

•	Consumer Forum Matters relating to the settlement of consumer disputes and redressal of grievances and settlement of claims arising thereof on District Forum, State Commission and National Commission. Recovery of dues.
•	Arbitration Matters, mediation and assisting in out of court settlement.
•	Financial Litigations and DRT Matters under the SARFAESI Act and SFC Act.
•	Various Court Litigations & Pleadings

Advocate Gupta has a wide experience in appearing before various tribunal and is a well known seasoned advocate before Hon’ble High Court, Calcutta and other Tribunals such as Land Reforms And Tenancy Tribunals and The State Administrative Tribunals. He is a regular in the District Courts in and around the state of West Bengal and also deals in Consumer Forums and other forums.

Outside his home state, he is a regular advocate who has already dealt with cases at the Delhi High Court, Gurgaon Courts and other Courts of the country at Guwahati (Asssam), Hyderabad and many more.
Advocate Chitra enrolled with the Bar Council of India (West Bengal) in 2004. He is a member of Calcutta High Court Bar Association and High Court Club.

He said i have relation with her, and he has admitted court to make my presence. i am asking you that, is it required for me to involve in the case with my presence? i am not interested to be involve in it.

if you have been made a party to the case then you need to appear and appoint a lawyer and defend yourself. Wife keeps going to her parents for months. How to file for divorce?

you can get divorce on grounds of desertion. And yes chances that you have to pay maintenance is high. You need to consult a lawyer for ways to minimize the maintenance. however you can not file a divorce within 1 year of marriage unless there are emergency situations on your part.

about: Advocate R. Madhuraj is the CEO of RMR Law Associates & Consultants LLP, the law firm at Trivandrum that has branches and associate offices in various parts of India & also at abroad. He is an international lawyer having office establishment at Dubai also and actively involved into the consultancy and conduct of cases and matters relating to UAE laws too.

Advocate R. Madhuraj has been practicing and handling cases independently with a result oriented approach, both professionally and ethically and has acquired excellent professional experience in providing legal consultancy and advisory services in various fields of law. His dynamic experience in India and abroad surely has enhanced his skills and analytical approach towards solving legal issues and queries. His experience as a lawyer in UAE has helped him gain excellent and quality experience. His understanding of legal issues, result-oriented approach, eagerness to impart awareness ethically, regarding legal norms specific to client requirements surely acts as assets for his clients.

Advocate R. Madhuraj provides legal services in a variety of legal areas including, but not limited to consumer court matters (handling of cases before CDRC), civil matters, criminal related matters, family matters, property matters and drafting and vetting of various agreements and documents. He has extensive knowledge and expertise in criminal law and has appeared in a variety of criminal matters in various courts in and around Trivandrum. He is equally competent to handle criminal matters in original as well as appellate side to achieve excellent results for his clients and is specialized in dealing with Customs Act, COFEPOSA and KAAPA related matters and has successfully completed matters before advisory boards, also doing excellent in Customs cases that includes adjudication and  appeals before CESTAT at various parts of India. Advocate R. Madhuraj has acquired considerable experience also in the fields of corporate litigation, commercial litigation, arbitrations, IPR and special contracts.

Adv. R. Madhuraj has associate office at the High Court of Kerala and had the occasion to appear before several High Courts such as Chennai, Bangalore, Allahabad, Mumbai,  Ahmedabad, and the Supreme Court of India. Adv. R. Madhuraj has also had the occasion to represent various clients in various forums; also acts as a legal advisor to many well known companies. Adv. R. Madhuraj is assisted by and associated with an able and enthusiastic team of lawyers who assist him in legal research and preparation of matters. Adv. R. Madhuraj has successfully handled disputes to achieve excellent results for his clients.

Advocate R. Madhuraj was enrolled with the Bar Council of Kerala in 2001 and is also a member of the Trivandrum Bar Association. He has a total of 21 years of professional experience in providing all kinds of legal consultancy and advisory services. These 21 years have led Advocate R. Madhuraj to gain proficiency, not only in arguing before the Honorable Courts, but also in consulting clients and even in the art of drafting and pleadings.

questions_answered: How to fast track divorce by mutual consent ?

sister was forced to marriage a guy she loved 2 years ago and they registerd their marriage in panchayat without permission from us. but she never leaved with him and now both are ready to mutually divorce their relation so please tell me  what is the mutual divorce procedure ?,how long will it take? are their any easy ways? Please tell us how to get divorce fast?

There is no easy way out for you other than to get a decree of divorce from a family court of competent jurisdiction. It can take for a period of 6-8 months after filing of the petition for divorce. Even for the matter of a remarriage in future, people stress on decree of divorce. So the same is inevitable for her for a better future. Anything further, you can contact me
Can rape case be filed after many years had passed in India?
Could a woman be able to file a rape case in India even after so many years of the incident in India?

The recent incidents makes police to have a rethought and insists on a preliminary investigation into the merits of the case in such matters where there is delay. Theoretically issue of delay is not applicable to file a cognizable offence like rape, though delay in lodging FIR is a ground of defence for the accused..
Can impotentcy can be ground for divorce in India?

My wife and her parents are trying to sue me, claiming I am impotent. I personally do not have any health issues, but I didn't undergo any medical check-up prior to marriage. We have not had sexual intercourse in the last four months. After our engagement, we faced several issues with them and tried to cancel the marriage, but they didn't allow it. Now, if I am tested positive for impotency, what will be my fate? My parents insisted on the marriage, and that's all I have done. I come from a poor family but have a good job, while my wife is from an upper-middle-class background. She is asking for a divorce. Our marriage is now four months old. Please give me suggestions. Both of us are Hindus, and the claim of impotency is being used as a ground for divorce.

Your wife can sue for divorce on the basis of impotency. But if you object to it in the court of law, they have to prove it by taking steps. For that you may need to undergo medical examination. If the impotency is proved then the divorce can be allowed. But impotency is of several reasons. Physical impotency is to be proved. A person may suffer from impotency due to mental elements; and that is temporary which can be cured. In that case we can stick on.
Vacation Club Is Not Delivering Services
I paid to vacation club but now vacation club is not arranging facilities as club offered...... not even from online or not even from call to excutive

It’s a deficiency of service and can be sued before the consumer court… there is proper scope that if filed and contested even compensation can be awarded… so you can darely proceed with legal measures
My Husband Need Me to Give Divorce

My Husband Need me to give him divorce . He has my son with him and not allowing to see my son or talk with him . Iam ready to give divorce but i need my son to be with me . He is doing all this to give me divorce and he dont want to pay any maintenance . he dont love my son he is using them for negotiation . What do you suggest i do ?

In fact the matter requires detailed discussion..we need to get the child through other legal sources, then approach the court in such a way that the custody of the child will remain with you .. there are provisions for that. Further if he files for divorce in between you need to contest it till the custody becomes clear … once the custody becomes safe, we can file to get maintenance too

questions_answered: Right to sell of co-owner after the first owners death

MY FATHER HAD ONE DDA FLAT WITH JOINT NAME OF MY MOTHER WITHOUT ANY % WRITTEN ON CONVEYANCE DEED AND HE ACQUIRED THIS PROPERTY BY HIS OWN MEANS. NOW MY FATHER EXPIRED AND MY MOTHER WANT TO SELL THIS PROPERTY, CAN SHE SELL THIS PROPERTY ALONE BY HER OR HER CHILDREN HAVE TO MAKE A RELINQUISHMENT DEED IN HER FAVOUR.

Yes all the first class legal heirs become owners of half portion. All legal heirs have to give relinquishment deed in favour of mother than only mother will have the clear title and can sell the same.
How Do I file for divorce?
How do I file for divorce? Need advice on procedure.

Hello , you and your husband have to file a petition of divorce on mutual consent together alongwith affidavits . both of your statement s will be recorded in the court . then after 6 months a second petition will be filed and then simillary both of your statements will be recorded again n then ur divorce will be final .
Married a girl but I have no proof can I stop her from second marriage

I married a girl in a temple but we didn't registered our  marriage not we have any photos for the same, I just have audio recordings where she is accepting that she has married me and few photos together and bills of hotels we went together. Can I stop her from doing 2nd marriage legally?

You should get the marriage registered as soon as possible, to prevent such an incident from happening. A marriage certificate should be sufficient proof of the marriage, whereas audio recording and all can be questioned.
Can i get divorce within 6 months of marraige?
Hi Sir, I got married in July lasy year. Can I seek divorce? Please help me.

You can seek divorce before one year of marriage. Please try to reconcile the differences with your spouse. Every marriage  has teething problems, and you should try to make it work . regards hope this helps

We can send a legal notice to procure all your pending FNF dues and requisite letters from the organisation if the same is as per the terms and conditions of your employment and the company has admitted to give the same. Feel free to connect for further assistance. Thanks
Quash the FIR

I had taken admission in a university by a institution and enrolled in BCD nowBCD found my law degree is fake and FIR loge against me on 2020 under section 471,468 and 420... and 2025 police give me Bond Down and chargesheet will be submitted soon.  Is those FIRs can be quash in high court if yes how many chances ?

Quashing of FIR can be proceeded with only on merits of the case. If you have material to prove the merits then we have chances to get it quashed from the Hon’ble High court. For further clarification feel free to contact.Thanks

questions_answered: Flat transfer from Brother to Brother

I brought properton my brother name paid by me.I have all transaction details.Now i wish to transfer the falt on my name with minimum expenses.My brother is ready to for the same.Kindly suggest the cheapest and legally valid route for the same

The only way is to execute a Gift Deed. You will have to pay Stamp duty of 3% and Registration Charges of ₹30000 If the property is situated in Mumbai.  If the property is situated in outside of Mumbai, You will have to pay Stamp duty of 4% and Registration Charges of ₹30000
Registration Settlement Deed and applicability of stamp duty on the it

Two brothers & mother (hindu) wish to enter into settlement deed for a flat in Mumbai where mother will transfer the flat to one brother after her death. Is it required to register the deed? stamp duty is applicable? is there any other option where other brother will not claim the property afterwards? is it required to get NOC/relinquishment from the brother who doesn't get the property?

You are not elaborated whose name is the property currently Rajasthan. The property registered in your mother's name, your mother can transfer the property in your name buy gift deed. It’s is mandatory to register the Gift deed and the Stamp duty is nominal as it’s from Mother to Son. If the Gift Deed is registered, then you don’t need the NOC from your Brother. This would work only if the Property is registered in your Mother’s name.
The Negotiable Instruments Act, 188's court jurisdiction and cases
Which Courts have jurisdiction to entertain complaints under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act? please explain with reference to landmark case/cases?

The Courts where you have your Bank account will have jurisdiction over the matter.  It is important to understand that you may deposit the Cheque at any Branch but only the Home branch will determine the jurisdiction under N. I. Instrument Act.
Joint Venture Issue with an indian Company
i had a joint venture agreement with an Indain Co and now we would like to depart the agreement , what would be the condition based on india commercial code ?

We understand that you had executed the Contract with Indian Co. normally in a Contract, grounds of termination are provided which would also include the manner in which either party can terminate. Under Indian Laws, the terms of your contract would prevail subject to they being not illegal. If your Contract provides that you can terminate the Contract by giving notice, you should give notice of your intention to terminate.Please be informed that this is preliminary view and we haven’t peruses your contract
Validity of will if made without informing me

My mom broke her back & was addmitted in hospital on 10th june 2019 & discharged in 24 june 2019. She stays with her daughter. Her daughter & brother in law refusses to provide any information about her. The flat is in my moms & my name. My brotherly law is makung will without informing me. If they register a will would it be considered a valid will.

If a Will is registered, in ideal situation, it would be treated as valid will. As you have informed in your query that you are joint owner of the Flat, you can enter the Flat without restrictions. In the event your Brother in law attempts to stop you from entering the Property, you can file a police complaint or even approach the Court

questions_answered: Recovery of money given to a Facebook friend

Given money to a facebook friend who needed money to go abroad through a company. Given proof that he belongs to a poor family, who is a CA and premised to return after few months of work. Initially given around a lakh. Then, he  asked money  for  Indian  rupees  as  he was  not  having sufficient  Indian rupees for  transfer into a savings account  in Icici bank  in bokaro steel city. Money  had been  given in his account but failed to transfer due to some  problems in the bank. It goes on  similar fashion and  total amount comes more than 7 lakh rupees till now. Now  my  question is  1. How can we get the money back? 2. How to  proceed? 3. Who can help us?4. How much will it cost?

You should send a legal notice first and demand back the money if he fails to pay then you can file a case against him You should send a legal notice first and demand back the money if you fail to pay then you can file a case against him
How to challenge decision of Family court to get maintenance or RCR

I have filed an application under section 125 CrPC for getting maintenance from my husband who has left me from 2009 onward after two month of marriage. My application was rejected dismissed under section 125(4) of CrPC citing that she is not entitled for maintenance as she has left her matrimonial home without any just or valid reason without finding any proof or evidence against. In his cross examination husband has already said that he is not ready to keep me now. please guide under which provision or act i can challenge the order passed by Principle Judge Family under section 125(4). Whether any alternate speedy remedy available in any law to get maintenance or restitution of conjugal right. he is not ready to keep me due to his family member only.

Yes you can always go in appeal against such an impugned order and you should also file section 9 for restitution of conjugal rights which will give You a better ground to get maintenance of he is still not ready to keep you with himself
Can step mother claim maintenance from son?

I am 29yr old stepson presently,working in pvt Ltd firm.My mother expired on Dec88 at my age(1yr),then my father remarried on Mar91.She delivered a girl child on Oct92.My father expired on DEC 92.I never resided with my stepmother. Still I was minor hence my guardian look after me since child wood. Stepmother is living separately no concern with her till today.My stepmother getting pension from deceased fathers accounts.Now she and daughter claims maintenance from me. Please clarify whether she and her daughter is entitled to claim maintenance from me or not?

No you are obliged to pay her maintenance as she is already getting pension as wife of your deceased father and she is able to maintain her self with that amount.where have your mother and sister filed a maintenance case against you?
What is the procedure for getting married to a inter-caste girl

Hello sir/Madam I am Hindu boy from jharkhand and want to marry a Muslim girl from Kashmir, without permission from girl family. Please guide me to take care for legal issue for girl family side. So that i can be save. Thank you.

You can amaze an application of marriage before the registrar of marriage with three witnesses and after expiry of thirty days from the day of application you can appear along with the girl before the registrar of marriage to get marriage registered and if both of you are of adults there will be no problem.
What is the procedure for divorce and maintenance rights of children
I want divorce ,I have 5year old son 7year old daughtermy income is 60000 from house rent.and what right to my son and wife of my house and rental incom

Are you working somewhere or rental income is the source of income you have?...in case of divorce and if your files a maintenance case against you considering your income the court can pass an order to give them maintenance amount.

questions_answered: Transfer of property from daughter to mother

My parents had a property in Ghatkoper which they had to sell to buy a property in Borivali to take care of new born grand daughter. This led to additional 6 lakh of outflow for which loan was taken. Since loan was taken name in agreement was daughters and not mothers. Now loan is fully repaid and need to transfer property to mother's name. Please suggest easiest and cost efficient method to transfer property to mother's name

Since you need to transfer you are rights a twin favour of your mother you need to execute a gift deed in favour of your mother very in the rights will be transferred to your mother. Executing a gift deed is the most cost efficient way to transfer your rights in favour of your mother.Regards
Live In Relationship Agreement
If we make a live in relationship agreement then can we get the police protection against assault or harassment by family or society?

Live in relationships are now acknowledged by the courts. Person staying in live-in relationships can stay together as per their will if they have completed their respective age of majority. Any person cannot take any  objection in their relationship. As a citizen of India the concerned person having any threat can approach the Police authorities for protection.Regards
Flat Possession Delayed Beyond Agreement Date

My flat possession is delayed by over 2 months (due end of Dec 2024). The builder claims everything is done but no OC received. They offer soft possession in 10-20 days. Should I accept soft possession? Can I claim compensation before or after possession? What is the best option? Agreement date for possession is 31 Dec 2024.

Since the building is complete and the builder is about to obtain OC it is advisable to take the possession and be on the safer side. However if you wish to seek compensation for delayed possession you can surely file an application before the competent authority and claim damages in the way of the licence fees paid for living on rental basis. However you will have to keep patience for the legal proceeding as the same will take its own pace..Regards
Purchased an open plot but no name on 7/12

I purchased an open plot of 2000 sq ft. at Karde village Tq. Shirur in 2017. My name doesn't show on 7/12. I also don't have original Kharedi khat. I have only attested copy by notary.What is the process to get my name on 7/12

for purchasing agriculture land you need to have agriculture certificate you should by the respective department. secondly the agreement needs to be registered... A notary document will not create any rights on the property.. While executing the Agreement for Sale stamp duty needs to be paid to the government and document needs to registered in office of Sub registrar.Regards
Receive or not a legal notice at police station
I had a call from police station to receive a advocate notice in a matter of cheque bounce..what should I do in it?

The police does not have any authority to serve the notice of the advocate through police station. However as per my experience it may be a summons from the court which the advocate might have served to the police station after filing of the 138 cheque bounce case. if you have received a call from the police authorities please collect the summons and remain present in the court on the respective date.

name: Advocate Vijay Tangri
practice_areas: Anti Corruption, Anticipatory Bail, Arbitration, Banking / Finance, Bankruptcy / Insolvency, Breach of Contract, Cheque Bounce, Child Custody, Civil, Consumer Court, Corporate, Court Marriage, Criminal, Cyber Crime, Divorce, Domestic Violence, Dowry Case, Family, Fraud Case, High Court, Insurance, International Law, Labour & Service, Litigation, Media and Entertainment, Medical Negligence, Motor Accident, NCLT, NRI, Patent, Pmla, Pocso Act, Property, Recovery, RERA, Succession Certificate, Trademark & Copyright
about: Mr. Vijay Tangri graduated in law in 1994 and joined the LLM program focused on corporate finance and International trade at Northwestern University school of Law Chicago, he began his career in 1995 as a negotiator with a law firm in Chicago and then as part of an investment banking firm in Chicago. Thereafter, from 1999, while being associated with one of the top Senior Advocates of the Supreme Court of India and later with a leading law firm of New Delhi, he worked extensively in litigation and corporate advisory field handling clients in the Oil & Gas, IT, Banking and Manufacturing industry. In 2004 he started working as an in-house counsel, he was first appointed by Motorola as its commercial legal contract manager and then by Huawei as a DGM commercial as part of commercial contract management at Accenture he was responsible for commercial legal management of global IT contracts signed in various geographies in industries such as telecom, technology, communications, health care, finance and manufacturing. During his corporate journey he was responsible for requirements related to Ethics, Property, Litigation, IPR, Regulatory Compliance and Corporate Law. While working for the corporates he was exposed to and successfully handled complex corporate & legal issues and learnt to suggest enabling solutions and implement strategies for businesses houses and clients.

Thereafter with the objective of understanding and servicing client needs he set up Law offices of Vijay Tangri to deliver highest quality services. He has collaborated and helped clients solve problems faced by them in their day to day operations and worked in collaboration with executives at client organization. Advocate Tangri has worked extensively in the information technology and  services industry and on legal issues faced by the IT industry, he has acquired  strong legal professional skills in Negotiation, Legal Compliance, Contracts, ioint venture, collaboration and investment agreements and governance. The firm advises and assists clients in relation to various corporate law issues including general corporate advisory, mergers and acquisitions, private equity, foreign exchange management issues, corporate governance etc. He has also advised individuals and corporate entities on various aspects of foreign investments and provided support to clients for interpretation and implementation of Data privacy and information security requirements.

Advocate Tangri Believes in duty to the society by volunteering for free legal services for the poor. Advocate Tangri provides services in various fields of Corporate Matters, Civil Matters, Labour & Service Matters, Arbitration Matter, Family Matters, Divorce Matters, Cyber Crime Matters, Cheque Bounce Matters, Property Matters and drafting and vetting of various agreements and documents.
Advocate Tangri enrolled with the Bar Council of Delhi in 1999. He is a member of the Saket Bar Association.

name: Advocate Anshul Gupta
practice_areas: Anti Corruption, Arbitration, Banking / Finance, Breach of Contract, Cheque Bounce, Consumer Court, Corporate, Criminal, Cyber Crime, Documentation, Fraud Case, High Court, Insurance, Medical Negligence, NCLT, NRI, Pmla, Pocso Act, Property, Recovery, RERA, Startup, Supreme Court, Wills / Trusts
about: Advocate Anshul Gupta is an Advocate on Record in the Supreme Court of India and the founder of ANG Partners Advocates and Solicitors, Advocate Anshul Gupta has been practicing and handling cases independently with a result oriented approach, both professionally and ethically and has now acquired many years of professional experience in providing legal consultancy and advisory services.

Advocate Anshul Gupta holds a Master degree in International Trade Law from Catholic University of Lyon, France and State University Lyon, France. Advocate Gupta graduated from Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law, Patiala. His dynamic experience in India and abroad surely has enhanced his skills and analytical approach towards solving legal issues and queries. His experience as a lawyer in, Germany, has helped him gain excellent and quality experience. His understanding of legal issues, result-oriented approach, eagerness to impart awareness ethically, regarding legal norms specific to client requirements surely acts as assets for his clients.

Advocate Anshul Gupta has extensive knowledge, expertise and has acquired considerable experience in the fields of corporate litigation, commercial litigation, arbitrations, IDR, IPR, special contracts and anti dumping issues.

Mr. Gupta has had the occasion to appear before several High Courts such Allahabad, Mumbai, Kolkata, Gwalior, Jabalpur, Chandigarh, Ahmedabad, Patna, Indore & Gangtok and the Supreme Court of India. Mr. Gupta has represented clients in various fora inter alia Company Law Board, National Company Law Tribunal and Appellate Tribunal, MRTP Commission, Competition Appellate Tribunal, National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission, Debt Recovery Tribunal and Appellate Tribunal, Appellate Tribunal for Electricity and Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal.  Mr. Gupta has acted as a legal advisor to some very well known companies. Mr. Gupta has also had the occasion to represent various clients in various fora.  Mr Gupta is assisted by an able and enthusiastic team of lawyers who assist him in legal research and preparation of matters. Advocate Anshul Gupta has successfully handled disputes to achieve excellent results for his clients.
Advocate Anshul Gupta has enrolled with the Bar Council of Delhi. Advocate Anshul Gupta's office is in Panchsheel Enclave and can be reached at his landline or hand-held.
