questions_answered: How to change advocate in court ?

Respected advocates my last question for civil first apeal in stage due course As you people advised me I consult with my advocate he replied me that it is high court yanha aisa kuchh Nahi Hota ,how to change lawyer in a case ?

Changing of advocate is not a hurdle talk. You may appoint a new advocate for your further proceeding if respective court allow in between the current situation. You may follow the steps as your convenience .1. Ask the court if you can change. ...2. Find a new lawyer. ...3. Terminate the representation with your initial lawyer. ...4. File a motion for substitution of attorney. ...5. File for a continuance, if necessary. ...6. Request your file from your former lawyer. ...7. Request return of unearned fees.
Is working wife liable to pay alimony if husband is unemployed india

My father died in 1998 and that on window basis my mother got job of government teacher in 1999 but in 2005 my mother married a person now he wants divorce and he is unemployed and my mother is still doing her job ,is there any chance of losing her job or she has to pay her second husband alimony if husband is unemployed at the time of divorce?

No dear, nothing to worry about. No problem in Job and not required to pay any type of alimony. your mother have right to continue her job without any fear and there is no any provision that a wife give alimony to her husband due to her job and his unemployment. So be relax. If you or your mother get any frighten call or words from him than can make a police complaint against him.
Can husband file for divorce if no physical relation	 with wife ?
Can a husband take a divorce if he is not sexually satisfy with her wife and what have to be proof and which type of grounds required, Can a husband take a divorce if wife is not sexually active ?

Yes husband can take divorce on this ground. Either man or woman is dose not response on their sexual relation then can file for divorce. the frequency of sex cannot be the only parameter to assess the success or failure of a marriage as it differs from couple to couple as to how much importance they attach to the sexual relationship vis-a-vis the emotional attachment.There may be cases where one partner may be overtly sexual and the other may not have the desire to the same level, but otherwise is fully potent, the court observed. The high court said in matrimonial cases, more often than not it is a challenging task to ascertain as to which party is telling the truth as usually it is the oral evidence of one party against that of the other. What happens within the bedroom is either known to the couple themselves or at the most to the members of the family.
Permission for higher education for govt employees rules

I am working in the Central Armed Police Force (CAPF). I completed my B.Ed. without taking permission from my department. Later, I got selected for a teacher's job, and once I received the appointment letter, I resigned from CAPF, saying that I could not continue the service for a long time.

Now, I want to know – can I do a regular course with a government job without taking permission from the department?

Hi, if you are a government employee, you can pursue a B.Ed. through correspondence or distance mode without any issue. However, if you want to do a regular course, you must take permission for higher education from your department first.

Also, make sure to check the admission requirements and follow the instructions of the concerned university or center before applying. This is important to avoid any problems later, especially if you're planning to use the degree for promotions or applying for another government job.
Money debited from my account but not credited,  what to do

Sir, i transfer money to my friend through tez upi app. bank deduct money debited but not credited in my friends account. Upi app show transaction successfully, bank deduct money but not credited. I go to bank but they didn't respond properly. So pls tell me what i do...?

Hello,Regards.This is a common problem in online transaction. You have to make a complaint in app's customer care center and also make a written complaint to your bank for such transaction. if still they dose not give any response than a legal notice should be issue against the bank as well as the app company.

questions_answered: How can I request a CBI enquiry when the police are not fulfilling their duty?

I filed a complaint against my business partner, shop owner, and others for illegally seizing my shop with the help of police involvement. I sent copies by post to the SSP, Human Rights Delhi MLA, Chief Minister of Punjab, Women's Cell, and the High Court judge. The accused obtained signatures on a Panchayati Rajinama with three witnesses from each side. We were coerced into signing these papers under severe threat, especially since the ASI involved had already lodged a false FIR against me. These influential individuals are obstructing police duty. How can someone request a CBI inquiry when the police are failing to perform their duties?

It's for the hon'ble high court to provide relief such type of matters.  But you can also avail other remedies. But its always advisable to go for proper process to get a relief. You can file a criminal complaint before the magistrates. As normally you can get proper relief from the court.  You can also file civil suit to get property back.So always choose proper course to get reluef
How can I file a complaint against an immigration firm for fraud in India?

In 2009, after graduating from college and seeking employment, a friend introduced me to Guru Kirpa Enterprises, an immigration firm in Mohali, directed by Neena Sharma. I paid them 1.20 Lac for a Canada work permit, but soon realized they were fraudulent. Despite requesting a refund, they failed to return my money. My father, a small farmer, borrowed that money with interest. We didn't file an FIR then because they assured us of a refund and abruptly shut down their office. Coming from a poor family and desperate for a job, I didn't pursue legal action. Recently, I discovered online that the director, Neena Sharma, was arrested in 2012 for 39 cases of immigration fraud and cheating. Can I file an FIR against her now, after 9 years? Please advise on my options. Thank you.

You can file a criminal complaint under section 420 of the Indian penal code and there is no limitation for filing a criminal complaint in case the offence is punishable with imprisonment for three years and more so go ahead
What is the procedure to get child custody without divorce?
Dont want divorce only want to live separate from husdand due to home voilance i want my boy child of 4+ year custody what to do. How to get child divorce before divorce?

You have to apply to the court to get the custody of the child in  that event court will fix time to meet child and the case will be further proceeded. Generally the custody of the child upto the age of five remain with the mother . After evidence the court will decide to whom the custody of the child paramount consideration is welfare of the child who can look after the child in better way so go ahead file tje applications for custody of the child the application will be filed in the court where child resides don't file a case at the wrong place in that event after so much exercise the case will be dismissed for want of jurisdiction
what is the contested dismissed meaning in court in India?
Status of district court case Nature of business shows-dismiss. Status shows-contested-dismiss. Does dat means my lawyer has asked to dismiss the case? what is the meaning of contested dismissed?

No lawyer will ask to dismiss the case the case dismissed when the process is complete i.e. the suit is filed and the defendant has appeared filed written statement evidence produced by parties arguments heard then the court pronounce it's decision I.e. dismissed or decreed never doubt the integrity of a lawyer

you can application before the civil court to meet you child and even you can apply for custody of the child but you have to prove that you cam look after the child in better way so that court is satisfied regarding the welfare of the child

found someone on telegram, they told me that if you rent bank account you will get certain amount of comission , i found one guy my telegram friend and i told him about this then that guy gave me an account and i acted as a middleman and given that account to that telegram guy who told me he will offer me comission ( he told me that account will be used legal trading but that was a lie ) , that time he used account and traded around 5 million rupees in a single day and told to withdraw comission that was about 100k , account owner took 50% and gave me 50% of comission remaining all 4.9 million rupees was transferred to unknown benifciaries , later account got frozen and we found out that cyber crime freeze account and account was used for fraudlent activities and we got scared now how we can protect ourselves as all money is transferred to unknown benifciaries and we got fooled by that telegram user who deleted his account, what are the legal remedies to protect ourselves?

you have been party to the crime.write down everything on a piece of paper and surrender yourself before the police commissioner CP or ACP or SP or DSP. don't meet anyone below this. don't show this letter to anyone below these ranks.you can also surrender yourself before the session court of your district.you might get arrested but approach one of these authorities before your account is frozen or police reach you.if you are working in any organisation inform the director or owner of the organisation immediately on talking to cp.inform your family members about it, specially wife, and both parents.keep faith in the judiciary and police.The safest is surrender before the sessions court of your district.you have already become party to some crime.
An Indian friend of mine convinced me for Investment in share market and I trusted him . He promised

An Indian friend of mine convinced me for Investment in share market and I trusted him . He promised to return money on certain dates and I never received a single rupee or dollar . So I contacted his family to ask why he never replied and what is he doing. To which family forwarded me a local newspaper ad showing that he is abandoned from his family and sp they don't take responsibility of him.Because I kept chasing his family members to cross check that he is truly abandoned or if it fake. He is now threatening me that he will also contact my family &work  show them my private pics & with random phone numbers and social accounts abusing me and threatening me that he will leak my private photos on adult sites and then fabricate whole thing. I cannot access Indian cybercrime because I don't have indian number with me. Overseas I got 2 complaints , for bullying and harassment and another for financial fraud. But local government here said that I need to contact Indian cybercrime.

first of all this may not come under cyber crime.it can be considered as fraud.file a police complaint in India. through your relative. inform your home and families also your close one friends in India.you will get email id of your City in India from internet. email your complaint.

questions_answered: Can fir be quashed after filing of chargesheet ?

Sir , I would like to know one thing , can I go to the High Court for quashing the case which is running with the only sec - 448 IPC against me . In the year 2018, a person had lodged an F.I.R against me u/s-384/120(B)/379/448 IPC & later , the police station gave me a notice u/s-41(A) Cr.Pc & thereafter , I had complied the said notice & I got anticipatory bail from the High Court . I knew that the said case is completely false .The said investigation has now been completed , the charge sheet has already been framed against me by only SEC 448 IPC which is absolutely bailable & rest of the sections have been withdrawn by the investigating officer .Till now, the trial has not been started so in such circumstances , can I go to the High Court for quashing this case ,can fir be quashed after chargesheet?, is it possible at this time? Please sir give me advice in this regard , what should I do ??

Definitely u can approach to the high court under section482 of crpc for quashing of the chargesheet along with FIR.the court has power to quash the matter on basis of sufficient evidence.offence may be bailable or non bailable but quashing  depand only sufficient evidence.
How can I obtain a No Objection Certificate for the registry of marriage in India? What is the proce

I am Arindam Mallick, an Indian (Hindu) from West Bengal currently working as a Production Manager in Bangladesh for an MNC in garment manufacturing. I married a Bangladeshi Hindu girl 1.5 years ago and we recently had a baby boy. However, we have not yet completed the marriage registry due to difficulties in obtaining a No Objection Certificate (NOC). I need guidance on how to obtain an NOC for marriage in India and the process for getting a marriage certificate.

If one of the parties is a citizen of another country , the registrar may request a “no objection letter”from the Embassy or Consulate of that country, and also may request proof of termination of any previous marriages,before a marriage certificate will be issued.
Can registered partition deed be challenged after 22 years ?

Whether any signatories person raised any objection regarding any partition deed which is registered before 22 years. Actually a registered partition deed was made in the year 1995 by amicable settlement and in that partition deed every share holder get the share. And after 22 years one of the share holder can file any case regarding cancelltion of the partition deed and create new partition deed by commission. can partition deed be challenged ?

If there is any mistake which has been discovered naw and which is required to be rectified ,otherwise certain legal difficulties will be created,in that cases the same may be challenged bt the essential point is limitation.
Can 498a case continue after divorce ?

We got married in 2007. We have a son (DOB 10.11.2010). We were staying separate since November 2012. In April 2013 she has filled a 498A ipc case. In April 2018 we have got mutual divorce. Our son stays with her mother. at the time of Divorce my wife did a notary where she had mentioned that within next 3 months from the date of Divorce she will withdraw the 498A case (it is mentioned in our divorce paper also that she will withdraw all the pending cases as soon as possible). But even after 11 months of our divorce she didn't take any attempt to withdraw it. She didn't even appear for the 498A case since last 2 years. But I'm giving my Hajira on every date. Kindly suggest me what action can be taken against it.

file an application  under section  482  of  CRPC    before  The Honorable  High Court  at Calcutta  for   quashing  The Criminal Case   under section  498 a  after  code of criminal procedure . you will   annex  the document   where it has been mentioned  that your wife will withdraw the case  after getting  divorce .
What should I do if the police do not follow the court's order?  Can it be considered contempt of co

Sir,

A lady obtained a final police protection order and residence order from the court of the Judicial Magistrate under the P.W.D.V. Act. The case was disposed of in 2018, directing her brother not to disturb, commit any acts of domestic violence against her, insult her, evict her from her father's house where she resides, or disconnect the electricity to her room. The court also directed the O/C of the local P.S. to provide necessary protection and assistance to the victim lady if needed. Despite this, her brother continuously tortures her mentally and physically, and she has lodged several complaints with the local P.S. seeking protection based on the court order. Unfortunately, the O.C. is not providing any protection. The court order is being violated by the police and the O.P. In this situation, can she go to the High Court based on this order? Is it possible according to the law if a court order is not followed in India, and can it be considered contempt of court?

Yes you file a writ under Article 226 of the Constitution of India for police inaction.you can also file a case for contempt of court against the officer in charge whome direction was given by the judicial magistrate for violation of the solemn order.

questions_answered: Remove wife name from property
Appartment is registered in both husband and wife name. Need to remove wife name from share/property registration. What is to be done?

To remove your wife as a co-owner from the house title you have to execute a release deed or relinquishment deed in your favour with your wife's consent. This will make you the absolute owner of the property.
Threatened by girlfriend for marriage

I’ve known a girl from 3 years. Initially became good friends and shared emotions. Despite having no sexual relationship with her, now she is threatening me that she’ll take legal actions if I don’t marry her. I recently found out about her bad & unacceptable actions she did in the past, so I decided to move out of the relationship. Now I’m being threatened.

Each partner has the right to walk out of relationship and your matter requires more details on the facts you are being threatened. For her to take legal action and stand valid in the court, you must be more descriptive of the situation and must talk to your lawyer with your facts.
Regarding claim of daughter's right in ancestral property

The property is divided among the brothers leaving the daughter, as the family has given her many privileges and gold, but she is trying to claim the property. After how many years of property division among brothers will she have the right to claim it?

As the daughters have the right to property, she can claim the property. But there are certain limitations such as she has to claim the property in a time limit of around 12years. If it exceeds the time limit but is supported with a valid reason, the court may accept and process the request of such.

Does the 6 sisters have any rights in property?nnProperty transfer mode nFather ( Lakshman) to son (sham ) by Settlement Deed

First thing, you should make sure the reason why it is a settlement deed but not a gift deed.The problem may arise in future so it is safer to take signatures from all sisters on the papers and it is better for you to scrutinize all papers and documents by a lawyer.

about: Advocate Sunil Sharma has been practicing and handling cases independently with a result oriented approach, both professionally and ethically and has now acquired many years of professional experience in providing legal consultancy and advisory services.

Advocate Sunil Sharma is a seasoned legal professional with over a decade of experience, known for his in-depth knowledge and strategic approach across a broad spectrum of legal domains. With a strong commitment to professionalism and client satisfaction, he has built a reputation for delivering effective legal representation and sound guidance. His academic background is equally impressive, holding multiple advanced degrees including a Master of Commerce (MCom), Bachelor of Laws (LLB), Master of Laws (LLM), Master of Social Work (MSW), and qualifications in Human Resources (HR).

Advocate Sharma’s practice spans several key areas of law. In Family Law, he handles matters such as divorce, maintenance, child custody, domestic violence, and property rights. His Criminal Law expertise includes cases related to anti-corruption, anticipatory bail, fraud, and the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. In the area of Civil Law, he deals with arbitration, cheque bounce cases, medical negligence, consumer court matters, and landlord/tenant disputes. Additionally, he is well-versed in Corporate and Business Law, managing corporate disputes, contractual issues, intellectual property rights (IPR), and general business laws.

Advocate Sunil Sharma also represents clients in High Court and Supreme Court matters, providing both legal advisory and courtroom representation. He is actively involved in proceedings across various judicial forums including District Courts, Sessions Courts, Family Courts, Consumer Courts, High Courts, the Supreme Court of India, and other specialized tribunals. His extensive experience and diverse qualifications make him a reliable and competent advocate across all levels of the legal system.

questions_answered: How much time does it take to get bail in IPC 302, and how to get bail in IPC 302?
Dear Sir/Madam, in the case KABD010007662020 where IPC 302 has been filed by the police, how can one obtain bail and how long does the process usually take?

Bail in a murder case depends on the facts and circumstances, there are many factors that would be considered such as the allegations.. the overt acts attributed to the accused.The number if accused will also make a difference.
Laws regarding the sex chat with married women in India

Had a sex chat with my brother's wife with her mutual consent but now the brother know about it. Their marriage is on verge of divorce, what kind of legal action can be taken on me in this?
I didn't shared any pictures or videos, didn't talked on phone just one day sexting! I have screenshots of the texts I and she have sent! I am not married and they(my brother and brother's wife) has a child too. what are the implications of sex chat in india ?

Since you say it was a chat and she also would have said explicit things to. Does the chat talk about any other issue?If the woman supports you you don’t have a problem but if she doesn’t then she could make things more complicated and she could initiate legal action. But having said so, I would need to know what was said in the chat before I advice you and also the history you have with this woman
My sister-in-law filed a false case under 498a and DP 3,4 against my elder brother, me and my mother

My sister-in-law filed a false case under 498a and DP 3,4 against my elder brother, me and my mother.\nBut now our brother and sister in law are together, and our sister in law has agreed to withdraw the case but tomorrow date 15 June 2023 is the first summon. The police are asking us to come together and can close the case but we don\'t have any bail, can we trust the police? I said that on 23rd I will come with my mother,  Will they take us into custody? Please let us know if we can go.

A case under section 489a can be quashed by the high court under section 482 of crpc.Approach the high court and have the matter quashed.Bail proceedings have stages and if you appear you will have to file a bailApplication and the prosecutor has toFile Objections and and argument have to take place and then the court can release you on bail on furnishings surety.If you appear before the court you will have to go through the bail procedures.498a can not be compounded u/s 320 crpc.Only the high court can quash the case
Regarding obtaining divorce under Hindu Law
This is Samyukta. I have question regarding obtaining divorce in a matrimonial dispute. Can a divorce be obtained within 15 days of marriage under Hindu Law? Should I wait for completion of one year?

The law is very clear that, divorce can be applied for on the completion of one year of the said marriageIn the even of an annulment of marriage on the grounds mentioned in the Hindu marriage act, the faster you apply the better it is. The period of one year does not apply
Khula, remarriage for better life of my child who is 5+. i want help..

I was married for 10yrs and My wife took khula with the help of some local social organisation stating domestic violence, dowry harassment, they forced me not to go to shariah court for divorce and made me sign agreement for dissolution of marriage and claiming money of 12lakhs which i am not liable for. I have a son of 5+yrs and they took him away stating child has to remain with mother till 12yrs of age. now the social organisation is calling and harassing me for money and take away your child. i would want to remarry her as i feel she took khula by force from family or social organisation. How can I go about it.

We have read your depiction of events, if you are saying that the divorce happened due to coercion, we will need more evidence to support that claim.Why is the socialOrganization contacting you, did you promise any monetary Beni fits to them?DoContact us we can helpYou

questions_answered: Notice to respondent should be given within how many days
What is the time period to reply to a legal notice sent by the opponent advocate?

Under law, there is no specific legal notice time limit prescribed for replying. Generally, the notice itself specifies the time limit to reply to a legal notice. If no time frame is mentioned, a reasonable period would be within thirty days of receiving the notice or before the filing of a suit. In case of any other queries, please feel free to contact.
Legal Action Against Bank for Service Deficiency: What Are My Rights?

I have had various relationships with the bank, including a savings bank account, credit cards, personal loan, and merchant relationship. However, the bank withheld my payout, leading to non-payment of credit card dues. Consequently, hefty interest and penalties were charged. Furthermore, the bank blocked my savings account, resulting in dishonored EMIs for other loans, leading to additional penalties. The bank has harassed me through recovery calls and agents.What are my options for legal action against the bank? Can I file an RBI complaint or a case in consumer court?

You can either file a recovery suit in civil court or a consumer case before the consumer commission (state or national depending upon the amount of recovery) or you can file both simultaneously. You should definitely take immediate action against the bank and get your hard earned money back.
tenant not vacating room after rent agreement is finished

our agreement finished in june2021, single room occupancy, on 10th aug was last date to vacant , tenant called police , what should we do now, we dont want to continue. He paid half amount of rent till date, and trying to convince for staying 7 more months. We cant trust ,kindly advise

The lease shall be terminated by you and you should take back the possession of your property by giving a notice for eviction. However, if he still does not leave you will have to take assistance of the Hon’ble Court. Since, he has called police once it is advisable that you take your steps carefully and after due consultation.
Cheque bounce case and recovery suit

I have filed a cheque bounce case and recovery suit on the same cheque amount. My question is if in the recovery suit i win and court award me amount and interest what will happen to the ni 138 case can the accused be sent to jail in ni 138 even if i get amonunt is recovery suit or it will be disposed off ?

It will be disposed off as per your terms of settlement. Likelihood of the person being sent into jail is extremely less. The maximum punishment that is awarded is double amount of cheque. However, I will be able to guide you better on knowing the facts of your case in detail
Cheque has bounced what should be sone now legally
Cheque issued to me is bounced.in how many days should i file a case or send a legal notice.

In the event a cheque has been bounced, the primary action to be taken is to inform the other party about the same and asking them to pay the cheque amount by sending a legal notice under section 138 of the negotiable instruments act

about: Advocate Jia Kapur is a reputed legal professional and a registered Trademark Attorney. She provides extensive advice to individual clients across various fields of law, including family disputes, property-related matters, divorce cases, arbitration, and more. She also specializes in matters related to trademarks and copyrights, offering guidance on applications, prosecution, renewal, and cases involving infringement and passing off.

Advocate Jia has a wealth of independent experience in providing efficient and effective legal solutions to her clients. She is also renowned for handling celebrity divorce, property, and family-related disputes with sensitivity and professionalism.
Advocate Jia has expertise in the following areas of law:
IP Law: Providing specialized assistance for trademarks, copyrights, and design-related issues.
Family Law: Resolving matters related to divorce, domestic violence, and child custody with utmost care. She also provides extensive advice on estate management through wills and gift deeds.
Property Law: Resolving property disputes, including partition disputes, and assisting with property deed verification, drafting, and registration.
Corporate Law: Offering support to business startups and companies with their contractual obligations and providing tactical management advice.
Civil Law: Resolving civil disputes through efficient litigation and strategic planning.
Criminal Law: Providing effective advocacy for both prosecution and defense.

Advocate Jia is an ethical lawyer, skilled in drafting accurate solutions and providing professional assistance to her clients. She is committed to delivering tailored resolutions that meet her clients' needs and expectations. As a compassionate and dedicated lawyer, her goal is to provide the best possible service to her clients. Due to her diligence and dedication, she is one of the most trusted lawyers in the legal fraternity.

questions_answered: Legal Notice Regarding Damaged Oven and Claim for Refund and Compensat
I ordered a ₹16,000 oven from Chroma, delivered via Kiran Cargo to Ladakh.It was poorly packed with just bubble wrap and arrived with broken glass.Chroma offers only repair, Kiran Cargo denies fault

Write a complaint to Chroma as well the cargo company for the same and ask for compensation or replacement of the product at their cost. If the needful is not being done then file a consumer forum complaint against them.For any further legal assistance please feel free to contact.
Stay order on property by my brother in lower court

My brother took a stay order on our joint property in which we are equal heirs.But I had already entered in sale agreement and took advance for my share a month earlier before the stay order.Should I go ahead with the sale.

No you should not, as that will be a contempt of court’s order. You can try to settle the matter amicably for speedy disposal, in order to sell off your share. For any further legal assistance please feel free to contact.
Person borrowed money in the name of help now not returning back the a
In the name of help i have given 26000 rupees to a person via phone pay now he not returning my money.

For the recovery of money you can send a legal to the person who has borrowed - sum of ₹26,000/- from you and in case he does not return the money even after the issuance of the legal notice then, in that case you can approach the court of law by filing a suit for recovery of money
Divorce case if case is submitted by wife and now she is not coming in
Wife not come in divorce case and she submitted case

So what I am able to understand is that your Wife filed for the Divorce and now she is the one who is not attending the hearings. In that case you can request the court to dismiss the case with heavy cost for non appearance and for wasting the time of the court. But the court will grant few opportunities to the other side in order for them to appear. For any further legal assistance please feel to contact.
Received Legal Notice For Not Serving Notice Period.

I was unable to serve notice period due to toxic environment of the office. And when I tried to give resign they denied to accept it as there was not replacement.  Hence I left the office . they even hold my salary of 20 days. About they toxic office environment I give review on their web side . letar they force me to delete the review. And delete the same . now they send me legal notice of Defarmation under section 356 . what should I do .

You can reply to the said legal notice stating all the facts and circumstances and further denying their allegations. You can also ask them to release your salary with immediate effect, as the company cannot withhold your salary. For more detailed review we will need to review your employment contract.For any further legal assistance please feel free to contact.
